outputs.output_descr:
The International Labor Organization (ILO), Department of Trade and Industry (DTI), Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) and the Philippine Crop Insurance Corporation (PCIC) of the Philippines requested GEF assistance to carry out a full-sized project on scaling up risk transfer mechanisms for climate vulnerable farming communities in Southern Philippines. The Project aims to provide assistance to scale up an existing adaptation initiative that applies a local financing and risk insurance model to rice and corn producers in vulnerable parts of North Eastern Mindanao, Philippines. 

This initiation plan will be implemented from June 20, 2012 to June 20, 2013.  Within this period, consultation and data gathering will be done at the national and local level to analyze national and sub-national policies and institutional capacities for sustaining and enhancing agricultural productivity and incomes in the face of increasing climate- related hazard and extreme events and longer term variability and change. The plan also includes defining and extending partnerships to support the widespread uptake of affordable and effective financing packages including weather index based insurance, together with investments in early warning systems and green economy based livelihoods diversification.

project_title: ScalingUp Risk Transfer Mechs for Farming CommunitiesPHL
